laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial blood pressure was 150/80 mmHg after starting captopril. Subsequently recorded as 160/100 mmHg upon readmission.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure control remained good after treatment with captopril; however, blood pressure increased to 160/100 mmHg during re-evaluation due to fever and depressive symptoms.
Fever persisted until the fifth hospital day; normalized after captopril discontinuation and treatment with nadolol and methyclothiazide.
